image.altText: A composite image feature a woman in front of the building development where she has bought an apartment

props.synopsis: Single mum Bethany Evans put down a $100,000 deposit on an off-the-plan apartment two years ago. When cracks appeared, she realised there was no way out.

title.children: Perth mum Bethany thinks you should hear her story before buying an apartment off the plan

image.altText: A boy and his dad smiling together while on a mountain.

props.synopsis: The South Australian police commissioner makes a public statement for the first time since his son's death, paying tribute to the "force of nature".

title.children: SA Police Commissioner pays heartbreaking tribute to son killed in alleged hit-and-run

image.altText: Smoke and an orange glow from a fire burning in the Cherry Gardens area of the Adelaide Hills.

props.synopsis: Residents left devastated by a bushfire crisis that destroyed homes in the Adelaide Hills in 2021 confront the firebug in court, telling the former CFS volunteer of their grief and terror.

title.children: Cherry Gardens victims tell of terror amid 'tsunami of fire' deliberately lit by ex-CFS volunteer

image.altText: two young women, one in a wheel chair being picked up by an access taxi

props.synopsis: The South Australian government will rollout its $25 top-up lifting fee for wheelchair accessible cabs to the state's regions following heavy criticism.Â

title.children: SA government agrees to extend disability lifting subsidy to regional access taxis

image.altText: A person with their trolley in a supermarket aisle.

props.synopsis: Minutes from the RBA's November meeting show the central bank decided to lift interest rates to their highest level in 12 years because of alarming signs that some businesses were passing on higher inflation costs to consumers.

title.children: 'Growing signs' businesses were passing on cost increases to consumers prompted latest RBA rate hike

image.altText: A teenage boy smiles for a photo.

props.synopsis: During the attack, Cian English and his friend were threatened with a knife, forced to undress, assaulted, robbed, degraded and tortured.

title.children: 'Haunted by what I did': Women who filmed teen's torture before his death spared further jail time

image.altText: Gloved hands make a heart and hold a vial of COVID vaccine

props.synopsis: We're in the grips of a surging COVID-19 wave but there's some good news â the new monovalent COVID-19 vaccines by Pfizer and Moderna will be up for grabs from December 11.

title.children: The new and improved COVID-19 vaccines will be available by Christmas. So who should get one?

image.altText: Optus CEO Kelly Bayer Rosmarin sits at a desk in front of a microphone at a Senate inquiry.

props.synopsis: Questioning what benefit the resignation of Optus CEO Kelly Bayer Rosmarin will have, Australia's first national anti-corruption commissioner warns a "blame culture" has led to scapegoating leaders for mistakes, rather than focusing on fixing problems.

title.children: 'Blame culture' behind Optus chief's resignation, warns anti-corruption commissioner

image.altText: Archie Roberts is tackled while playing for the AFL Academy

props.synopsis: The second night of the AFL draft will offer another opportunity for the next generation of players to find a club and begin their professional careers. Follow every pick in our live blog.

title.children: AFL draft continues as hopeful young players face nervous wait

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Who should you be looking out for tonight?
When does tonight's draft start and who's up next?

image.altText: A silouhette of an elderly Aboriginal woman against the background of a orange, blue and white Indigenous designed artwork

props.synopsis: A new report has found almost four in 10 First Nations people are experiencing high levels of violent and aggressive racism.

title.children: 'Pepper sprayed, knocked to the ground': Elderly Indigenous Australians share racism experiences in online register

image.altText: A composite image of James Rose and Stephen Gale.

props.synopsis: Police say they have found the fuselage of a plane which crashed into Port Phillip bay on Sunday. The wreckage will be removed from the water and searched.

title.children: Wreckage of plane that crashed in Melbourne's Port Phillip bay found, police say

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A composite image of lightning and heat

props.synopsis: Storms carrying the risk of heavy rain, large hail, and damaging winds are set to hit much of northern and eastern Australia this week while Western Australia bakes under a potential record-breaking November heatwave.

title.children: Week-long spell of extreme heat and storms to hit Australia

image.altText: Headshot of a woman in sunglasses walking in a city street

props.synopsis: John Hancock and Bianca Rinehart appear in WA's Supreme Court together for the second day as they continue their very public legal feud with their mother over mining royalties they claim their grandfather left for them.

title.children: Gina Rinehart's children maintain united front against her in legal showdown over mining riches

image.altText: Wire on top of a wire fence as the sun sets behind it

props.synopsis: A document published by the High Court has offered a snapshot of the crimes committed by a cohort in immigration detention now ordered to be released. While some had assaulted children or murdered people, others had no convictions in Australia.

title.children: Document reveals snapshot of crimes of immigration detainees implicated by High Court ruling

image.altText: Cinema audience

props.synopsis: Young people are continuing to bear the brunt of rising interest rates and rent while older Australians are still splashing out, new spending data indicates.

title.children: Younger people now even cutting back on essentials, as older Australians spend up on cruises and restaurants

image.altText: Sports commentator standing with a microphone in his hands during a live broadcast

props.synopsis: The 53-year-old was charged after officers attended his unit in March amid concerns for his welfare.

title.children: Michael Slater sentenced over Noosa Heads police altercation

image.altText: A wet wombat on a footpath near a body of water.

props.synopsis: A wombat earns the nickname, Ian Thorpe, after swimming for nearly 40 minutes before being rescued by a woman in a kayak from Yerrabi Pond in Canberra's north after a thunderstorm.

title.children: Wombat nicknamed Ian Thorpe after being rescued from Canberra pond by woman in kayak

image.altText: Traralgon Creek floods residential streets, drone photo

props.synopsis: An inquiry into Victoria's 2022 flooding event has been told the state's current warning system is broken.

title.children: Flood evacuation alert delays laid bare in search for better warning system

image.altText: A giant concrete slab with several holes in it, stands amongst a pile of rubble.

props.synopsis: The United States says it believes Israel and Hamas are moving closer to a deal that would secure the release of some hostages held in Gaza.

title.children: US says hostage deal between Israel and Hamas is closer than before

image.altText: Annette Kellerman standing on a rock by the ocean with her hands up as if she's about to dive into the water

props.synopsis: Here are six times clothes, and the people who wore or designed them, helped forge the story of our country â for better and worse.

title.children: 'Is there anything this woman couldn't do?' The trailblazing Aussie feminist who shaped our beach fashion

image.altText: A woman outside the ACT Supreme Court.

props.synopsis: A female intruder who invaded the Canberra home of a former friend she believed had killed her dog, smashing furniture and attacking the victim, is sentenced to a nearly four-year intensive corrections order to be served in the community.

title.children: Canberra woman who attacked former friend she believed had killed her dog avoids further jail

image.altText: Emma Walters wearing a floral pant suit leaving court with her legal representatives.

props.synopsis: A secret recording played in court reveals Emma Walters, the estranged wife of union figure John Setka, told a private investigator "I have to kill my children's father to survive".

title.children: Private investigator tells court he feared for his safety while meeting with John Setka's estranged wife

image.altText: Anthony Albanese smiles while shaking hands with Xi Jinping, whose head is turned away from camera

props.synopsis: Just days before Xi Jinping and Anthony Albanese shook hands at the APEC summit, Australian divers were injured by Chinese sonar. It begs the question, is the on-stage diplomacy all for show?

title.children: China says Australia made an 'irresponsible accusation' over sonar incident. Were the handshakes just for show?

image.altText: HMAS Toowoomba

props.synopsis: China's denial that it sent sonarÂ pulses that left Australian naval divers with minor injuries has been labelled propaganda by the opposition.Â

title.children: Opposition rejects China's response to sonar injury claim

image.altText: A man in a suit stares ahead outside a court house with another man in a suit next to him on his right.

props.synopsis: A court has found the police officer son of former senator and NSW premier fabricated evidence with the intent to mislead a judicial tribunal.

title.children: Kristina Keneally's son guilty of fabricating police statement that led to innocent man spending weeks in jail

image.altText: Mark and Simon stand in front of the bus and look at the pods. You can see the individual rooms with a bed and portable toilet.

props.synopsis: A volunteer on a sleepbus dedicated to vulnerable Sunshine Coast women and children says a night of rest can help people make better decisions.

title.children: Inside Queensland's first Pink Sleepbus to help homeless women get safe night's sleep

image.altText: a man sleeps in an emergency department hospital bed wrapped in a blue blanket. a woman sleeps sitting up on a chair beside

props.synopsis: When an ambulance took Jake to the PA Hospital, he was told there were no beds available and was parked in a hallway on a trolley. It would be more than eight hours before he'd see a doctor.

title.children: Jake waited eight hours in a hallway before he was given an ER bed. This is what ramping looks like

image.altText: A giant red wave of rock with people nearby.

title.children: Elder slams partygoers for 'disrespecting' 2.7-billion-year-old sacred rock

image.altText: Georgia Godwin catches one of the uneven bars during a gymnastics competition.

props.synopsis: Georgia Godwin is the fifth Australian to have a gymnastics move officially named after her, saying it is "an absolute dream come true".

title.children: Australian gymnast joins the likes of Simone Biles, with uneven bars move officially named after her

image.altText: A young man in a blue shirt holds a baby

props.synopsis: An officer told the court she initially believed there were no working body cameras at Wellington Police Station on the day officers attended the home of Brandon Rich, who died while being taken into custody.

title.children: Inquest hears officers were not wearing body cameras while arresting Indigenous man who died

image.altText: A man playing guitar and singing

props.synopsis: The Golden Guitar Awards received 762 entries for country music's flagship event,Â as artists new and old look to make their mark.

title.children: Young artists take centre stage as 2024 Golden Guitar finalists are announced in Tamworth

image.altText: Joe Biden points to a massive turkey from his presidential lectern

props.synopsis: The octogenarian holds the record as the oldest president of the US, with most respondents of a recent poll saying he is too old for the job and casting doubt on his mental sharpness.Â

title.children: Joe Biden jokes about his age while pardoning turkeys on 81st birthday

image.altText: SINGLE USE ONLY Vincent Namatjira and portrait on Country

props.synopsis: Iconic artist Vincent Namatjira was the first Indigenous artist to win the Archibald Prize, with his bold portrait of Adam Goodes. Now, his vibrant portraits will be on display in a very special survey exhibition.Â

title.children: 'Art is a weapon, art is powerful, art changed my life': Vincent Namatjira in his own words
